Description: Pottery ostracon: fragment of a jar bearing plan of a temple and hieratic text. On one side only, in black ink a rough sketch of a working plan for peripteral shrine, together with some measurements and a note of orientation.
Curator's comments: See B. Porter & R. Moss, 'Topographical Bibliography of Ancient Egyptian Hieroglyphic Texts, Reliefs and Paintings' I (Part 2) (Oxford, 1964), p.624. C. Simon-Boidot in L. Gabolde (ed), Hommages a Jean-Claude Goyon (BdE 143, 2008): 360-73. J-C. Goyon 'et al.', 'La construction pharaonique du moyen empire à l'époque gréco-romaine : contexte et principes technologiques' (Paris, 2004). p. 84 n. 29, fig. 50. S.R.K Glanville, 'Journal of Egyptian Archaeology' 16 (1930), pp.237-9 and pl.XLII, fig.1; W.Hayes, 'Journal of Egyptian Archaeology' 46 (1960), p.50; William. H. Peck, 'Drawings from Ancient Egypt' (London, 1978), pp.194-5; Charles C. van Siclen, ‘Göttinger Miszellen’ 90 (Göttingen, 1986), pp.71-7 'idem', ‘Göttinger Miszellen’ 94 (Göttingen, 1986), p.95; A.Badawy, 'A History of Egyptian Architecture' III (Berkeley & Los Angeles 1968), pp.282, 284.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (136371) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/136371)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2013, Apr - Jul, Paris, Louvre, L'Art Du Contour 2013/2014, Sept - Jan, Musée royaux d’art et d’histoire, Brussels, L'Art Du Contour
Condition: Fair, damaged at top and below left.
